newsitem.title: QATAR: Qatar Airways, BA in $8.8mln systems deal.
newsitem.headline: Qatar Airways, BA in $8.8mln systems deal.

text.p: Privately owned Qatar Airways has signed a 32 million riyal ($8.8 million) deal with British Airways for the supply of a new computerised reservation system, Qatar Airways chief executive Akbar al-Baker said on Thursday.

"The BA system, known as BABS, in conjunction with the travel agency systems, Sabre and Galileo, will help the airline improve its reservation processing, check-in and revenue accounting systems," al-Baker told reporters.
The system will be introduced on April 1.
The agreement was signed on board the British royal yacht Britannia at Doha Port on Wednesday by Alan Parrott, general manager of BA subsidiary Speedwing, and Baker.
Qatar Airways currently uses SITA for reservations and a manual system for revenue accounting.
